title: Party IP Weekend may be a way to reduce toxicity
body:
**Now, I may be way off the mark, and this could only apply to me, so tell me if I am.** 

When I am in a game, although I am not usually anywhere near toxic unless someone starts flaming me a lot, I may say something in /all chat like "**omg this viktor lol**" or "**NA Ganks**" or some shit like that. 
Ik, that is still flaming, and I'm not saying it's not, just saying that I do normally say stuff like that in certain situations, as I'm human, and h**ave flaws I need to work on in order to seem like a cumstain to less people.**

But onto what that all has to do with Party IP weekend.

In the party ip weekend, I normally just invite everyone who is online in my friends list. 
In champ select during party-ip, **I will always give up my role (jg) if someone else wants**, even tho **normally I would say go to hell** (not in chat, just in my action i.e. locking my champ, since i called tho role, even tho they asked nicely)

So we'll get into a game, and maybe the top feeds the enemy Irelia more than a Snorlax who's got the munchies, or the duo bot gives up a double every time they walk into lane. Under normal circumstances, I'd be like "jesus fkn hell", but in party ip weekend, I will either say nothing, try to help us get back on track, or something like that.

**Why?**
Ig honestly it's because once you form a group for party-ip weekend, you form a bond with them sort of. You guys are playing with eachother, and you all get more ip to by those runes that cost you a fkn foreskin. and while the motivation for being nicer to eachother may be selfish, it still ends up with people being nicer to each other.

**So, you guys tell me, am I just a shallow person who will be nice to anyone for more ip, or are we ALL shallow people who will be nice to anyone for more ip?**
